I picked up this game on sale and couldn‚Äôt be more pleased. I only play zombies so I can‚Äôt say much about the multiplayer or campaign, but zombies alone makes this game worth it. On Steam, the game comes bundled with Zombies Chronicles which includes most of the maps from World at War and Black Ops 1, as well as Origins from Black Ops 2. I think it has nine maps in total, not counting the return of Dead Ops Arcade. My only complaint is that it doesn‚Äôt include more Black Ops 2 maps. That being said, incredible custom map makers have at least partially recreated most of the classic maps left out of Chronicles and created countless more original maps of impressive quality. Additionally, the introduction of gobble gums adds interesting gameplay mechanics, a surprising amount of replay-ability and a host of new strategies. 

I‚Äôve played most Treyarch zombies games and I‚Äôd absolutely argue this is the definitive edition of the game mode. If you‚Äôre a fan of zombies I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll be disappointed.

Hello guys. I got this game at a discount as well as zombies cronicles. Lets be real, anything but zombies in this game is trash. Zombies is the only mode that i can recommend. Campain is meh. Multiplayer community is toxic. 

So lets get to it. Zombies cronicles bring back classic zombies maps slightly reworked with new guns, perks, powerups and gobblegums. some maps are very tricky for new players . But there are more than enough tutorials and strat guides online. If you are bored there is a ton of community made mods and maps for free of course. In general zombies players will help and carry your ass (happened to me plenty of times) to get easter eggs. However you better play with friends because the lag is huge . Unfortunatelly i cant get many easter eggs on solo because they are for 4 people.

Overall good game if u want to play classic or new zombies maps.However definitellly NOT worth this price tag. Try to get it on discount if possible.

Last thing you will notice the global achievements are ridiculously easy. you can get a 0.8% achievement  in like 2 tries on a solo run.

I played a ton of World at War custom zombies and I love the better graphics and the simplicity of creating and uploading to the steam workshop. That aside, I own this game on xbox with all of the dlc besides zombie chronicles and I really want to purchase the zombies maps and zombie chronicles on pc. I know the mulitplayer mode of this game is not as big as it used to be so that is why I do not want to purchase the entire dlc packs but the maps individually. I played this game on xbox and the multiplayer is amazing and same on pc but there are more hackers now a days (downside of pc) which sucks but it is whatever. I beat the campaign on xbox as well which was fun but not the primary reason I would ever play this game. I am a firm believer that black ops 2 is better than this game in multiplayer but now with custom zombies makes this game equal to black ops 2 zombies. I really want to play mob of the dead, buried. and nuketown zombies on black ops 3 and I will be satisfied. Though that is unlikely they will make it for zombies (but maybe workshop could have it soon). Overall great game but would not recommend to buy on pc unless you are a huge zombies fan or you have a bunch of friends to enjoy multiplayer and zombies with (hackers on public games suck).

So if you're thinking about this game at this point, you're likely looking at Zombies or Campaign. I'm not really a zombies player, but it seems to be the most complete package ever made for Zombies, so if that's your jam... ignore me.

As for the Campaign, man what a weird disappointment. Starts off pretty well, but the story makes no sense. It's trying to be something metaphysical, almost like it wants to be a Deus Ex game or something. CoD Campaigns are reliably stupid and this one can't even get that right! In the first third there are these moments of tension but by the end, there's so much technobabble and unexplained story beats that it's tough to know what's going on.

Reading about the ending on forums and stuff is interesting, there's bones of something really cool but the execution is lacking. Environments get pretty repetitive. If you're just looking at Campaigns, skip this one.

!!!!!!!!!!!!THIS IS A ZOMBIES MODE REVIEW!!!!!!!!!!!!

Okay, so originally this review was negative for its various gamebreaking bugs and pay to win gameplay. but as time progressed I say its unfair to negatively rate a game that I hold dearly all because of 1 gamemode: Zombies.

Seriously if you want to have a fun time with call of duty zombies, BO3 is your go to game (only if you have a beefy computer, if not, go play WAW), as the DLC maps are really fun, especially Zombies chronicles.

yes there are still a few gamebreaking bugs and theres a few hackers that are easily avoidable, but behind that, this game IS fun and easily replayable. Its also a plus that theres modtools allowing everyone to download maps from the workshop. even though 90% of the maps are test maps, clickbaity maps, and straight up garbage, there are plenty of diamonds in the sulfur mine.

So after 3 years later do I suggest buying BO3? Yes for zombies, Eh for campaign (only played once) and maybe if you are a multiplayer fan who likes online slot machines.
I recommend this game to anyone who still wants to play zombies and have a good time

BO3 is a god tier Zombies experience. With Chronicles, as well as the steam workshop/custom map support, you can play almost every previous map from previous Zombies games (World at War, Black ops 1, and Black ops 2) all in one title, along with the new maps that debuted in Black ops 3. The modding community has yet to waver, even after mod tools being out for almost 4 years. With support for mods as well as maps, you can relive experiences such as Town and Kino Der Toten, while even using weapons accurate to the titles these maps appeared on, instead of the vanilla BO3 weapon selection. 

Multiplayer and Campaign are hardly worth talking about. As with many CoD games, the multiplayer is usually dead after about a year of release. The Campaign mode is hardly playable as well, due to the uninteresting story that fails to capture the player and entice them to complete the story. 

If you like Zombies, this game is a must-have for your Steam library. I have this game on Playstation 4, and have over 20 days played in Zombies alone. I recently picked it up on Steam because it was 50% off and I wanted to play custom Zombies, and over the past few weeks, I have found it difficult to walk away from the game for more than a few hours, unless it's to sleep or eat food.

If you are thinking of buying this game, do it only for the Zombies mode. That being said, you're going to need the "Zombies Deluxe" edition if you want the entire experience, or at the very least, the "Zombies Chronicles" edition. I recommend waiting for this game to go on sale again if you are interested, unless you have $100 to blow.

I'll keep campaign and multiplayer short since few people buy this game for those gamemodes anymore.

Campaign:

Arguably the worst in COD history. To give you a perspective: 9% of the people who ever played camoaign, actually finished it. The story is weird and doesn't make sense overall. If you liked BO2 or BO1 you are going to be very disappointed since there are zero similarites between those two games and BO3.

2/10

Multiplayer:

Actually ok. Yes i know it has exo movement and all, but they really found a good combination with the concept of old COD and new COD. The weapons and maps are well constructed and the specialists are actually a fun addition to the game,  The real problem is that the playerbase is largely dead or dying. The concept of black market weapons is a scummy Activision business model, but the weapons are not that overpowered. Whoever made those cringy victory dances deserves a few years in the gulag though.

6.5/10

Zombies:

Now this is where the fun begins. 

First let's talk about features that singles out BO3 from previous Treyarch zombies games.

The movement system has improved from BO2. The sliding is actually pretty helpful when you want to get around a large map. Double pack a punch has been named overpowered, but has made high rounds much more accessible to casual players. The gobblegum system is also fun and extremely helpful. Some gobblegums are definetely overpowered, but are useful for the BO3 easter eggs who have been increased in difficulty. Yes the complexity has been increased. Especially compared to BO1 maps. The specialist weapons also make going for high rounds a lot more fun

Now come my recommendation for map packs

Shadows of Evil:

Yes this map has a high learning curve. Getting to pack a punch and unlocking the specialist weapon may seem like the Da Vinci Code for new players, but is done without a whim by those who know the map. The story behind the map and the playable characters is very unique and interesting. The wonder weapon is very effective and easy to build. Going for high rounds is pretty challenging since the streets of the map are narrow and hard to train zombies on. The easter egg is ok just not that special. It also requires 4 players which is ridiculous

The Giant:

Very fun and simplistic. Getting to pack-a-punch, the power and the wonder weapon is easy. You can get setup on round 7 and even earlier if you use mega gobblegums. Going up until round 40 is fun because of the camping spot called "the catwalk''. After round 40 your weapons (except double pack a punch) are useless and you have to hoard zombies. 

Der Eisendrache:

PERFECTION. I would say that this map is appealing to every type of zombies players. Turning on the power and going for the pack-a-punch is easy. The buyable doors on the map are not expensive which can set you up very quick. The wonder weapon bows are PERFECT. It makes the map unique and very replayable. Going for high rounds is both possible for people who like to camp with their wonder weapon and people who like to train zombies. The specialist weapon is easy to unlock and the easter egg is fun and made challenging with a boss fight at the end. 10/10 would buy

Zetsubou No Shima:

Scroll further if you are a casual player. This map requires you to build a ton of buildables which can take 1 hour for beginners. And when i say ''required'' i mean that. If you want to go for round 100 you are basically obligated to go for the easter egg(easter egg is not hard though). This is because the only training and camping room is the easter egg boss room. This map punishes casual players but rewards those who are willing to invest a lot of time in a zombies game

Gorod Krovi:

Very simple and fun to get setup on this map, but an absolute challenge to go for high rounds. The wonder weapon is useless after round 40 and there is no good zombies hoarding area except for that annoying bunker.  It is fun and not too hard to go for the buildables and pack a punch on this map. The easter egg is hard but a good and healthy challenge. And PPSH.

Revelations:

If you don't mind a huge recycling bin of a map where 90% of the content has appeared on earlier maps, then this is your map. Very easy to get setup, very easy to get the wonder weapons, and very easy to go for high rounds. I think that another map appealing to casual players was needed though. 

Chronicles:

Basically a huge remasteer of old mas. It contains maps from various degrees of size and complexity from earlier COD games. It is once again filled with nostalgia and very fun to revisit solo or with friends. I definetely recommend buying this. 

10/10

Overall zombies (why you probably are here) is filled with 14 of COD zombies finest maps. The price is high i agree with that, but the content that you are getting is SO GOOD.

Sorry for the long post

Black Ops 3 is probably one of my most played games of all time. There's a solid chance I had over a 1000+ hours on Xbox One. While many didn't see it back then, I do truly think this is a worthy follow-up to Black Ops 2(other than Campaign but I don't really care much about that part). The multiplayer was a lot of fun when it was still really active, though they got a bit greedy with all the micro-transactions. Some of the DLC weapons were abit much, but not impossible to counter. Dark Matter was also a really fun thing to try and achieve, and there's plenty of weapons to master and challenges to beat here. The side modes in this game are fun, I didn't care for Nightmares though. Dead Ops Arcade 2 is a great follow-up to the first one from Black Ops, and Free Run was a fun distraction. 

Then there's Zombies. While there were some balancing issues, like how double Pack-a-Punching in tandem with certain Gobblegum made it ridiculously easy to get to really high rounds, I personally think Black Ops 3 Zombies is better than Black Ops 2 Zombies. All the maps in this game are great in their own ways, then once Chronicles came out that just made it even better. Some of the remastered maps still don't have the Pack-A-Punch machine which is unfortunate, but atleast that gives those maps some challenge. But now that you can get Chronicles and the base game for the normal retail price, it makes the game even more worth it. All that and I still haven't mentioned the Custom Maps. Easy to install through Workshop, and there are some really good maps in here. Not all of them are great, but that's what you get with fan-made content. This game is definitely still worth buying in 2020, in my eyes this was the last great Call of Duty game, up to this point. I recommend it to any fans of Call of Duty, or shooters in general. Its more than worth re-buying on PC if you had it previously on Xbox or PlayStation.

Black Ops 3 Zombies is easily the best Call of Duty Zombies game. With all the DLC you have 14 zombies maps with a leveling system and progression system like no other previous iteration, and you additionally have the boatloads of workshop content available for custom zombies maps

Having played this game for countless hours on PS4, Xbox One, and PC I can safely say that for the past 5 years this game has brought me plenty of enjoyment. While the campaign lacked on many fronts the multiplayer was astounding. Back when I first heard about the advanced movement system I thought it was going to make the game not as good like in Sledghammer games's 2014 release Advanced Warfare, but I was corrected by the polished movement system and underwater warfare. none of the guns felt underwhelming in multiplayer and I felt as if the specialists fit nicely in the mix. The microtransactions and DLC weapons where you had to gamble with the cryptokeys until you finally got 1 of the way too many guns that were hidden in these boxes made the game slightly unfair in favor of those with money to spend on the game. The Zombies mode in the game was also very unique and enjoyable. The original map that came with the game took some getting used to, but now that I have learned some of the fasted ways to set up and understand the map more it easily slides right into my top 5 maybe even top 3 maps of all time. The experience was a blast and I still find myself playing not only the maps made by Treyarch, but also the ones made by the community. The game had an amazing easter egg storyline and even with the negative feedback for the revelations ending, I felt that it was nice to see what our previous actions led to with the restarting of the cycle. The guns on zombies feel a bit too equal making guns like the raygun feel like all the rest really taking away from the special feeling of having one of the wonder weapon. The community part of the game on PC is outstanding, with all the new creators and veteran creators the maps on here with the mod tool client are coming out amazing and some even feel like genuine Treyarch experiences. Once again the Liquid Divinium paywall blocking you from a major part of the game, the mega gobblegums, was a huge kick in the rear. While your friend pops perkaholic every game making him god tier on round 1 you're sat alone with 1 or no perkaholics just trying to grind for the diviniums because you don't have money to just toss at a game. The "Bonus" games were amusing fun and can occasionally be fun. The "Free-Run" addition was a good idea since it helped people learn how to use and improve with the movement system. "Nightmare" was cool, but like the campaign it lacked some so I never played it through. And finally comes the return of "Dead Ops Arcade" with its sequel "Dead Ops Arcade 2" which kept the original game's glory while adding some interesting features which either didn't matter enough to require attention or made the mode just a bit better. All in all I would give the Campaign(s) a solid 1/5, Multiplayer a 3.7/5, and the Zombies a 3.9/5.

I don't want to be one of those people who absolutely loves the game and still doesn't recommend it but unfortunately the constant stuttering in this game forces me to. I absolutely love this game to death, i have around 35 days on xbox (probably about 90% of that time is in zombies) and i loved every moment of that time. Seeing this game go on sale i instantly jumped at the opportunity to own and play everything again and now with the addition of custom zombies which is something i wanted to play so badly when i was on console and didn't have access to it. I booted up the game and tried to play DE when i was met with a barrage of both general stuttering and micro stuttering, constantly. The micro stuttering happens so often to the point where it becomes infuriating to play the game and hurts my eyes from the constant dips in framerate. Before you ask, yes, my computer far and away meets the recommended specs for this game and yet i was still suffering from this issue which limited my experience to one that made me wish i was blind and seeing the game as some sort of hallucination in my blank empty eyes. If the game doesn't stutter, it's a masterpiece. Zombies in this game is the best (Call Of Duty) zombies experience to date with some of my personal favourite maps (SOE, DE, GK) and on top of that includes so many beautifully done remastered maps in chronicles, and to make this even better, custom zombies offers unlimited replayability, with mappers still making amazing experiences to this day that rival the quality that treyarch themselves put out. Overall, this game is great. Is it worth $90 (aud) for the base game + chronicles and $140 for the whole experience at full price? No, not 5 years after launch. Should you buy the game if its on a heavy sale? Absolutely. The game is golden, however, if you get constant irritating general stuttering and micro stuttering like me and try everything to fix it to no avail, i would suggest you refund the game just like i did.

I'm a long time zombies fan. In fact, a good part of the reason I got this game was because I could get some of the maps I still didn't have for black ops 1 with the zombie chronicles deal (still $15 per dlc on ps3!!!!). When I tell you though, that I wasted that money on the zombie chronicles edition, I mean it. The steam workshop is amazing. You get a mix of hard maps, funny maps, and just really cool ones. Instead of having to memorize all the steps to do well on the official maps, you have to just figure it out on these maps and its so much fun. Like I got to round 10 on one map (Thomas the Train Engine: Crank Station) and I never figured out how to get power on, but I kept running into cool little features. THERE IS A MONOPOLY MAN ZOMBIE!! This isn't the only cool map I've found, but in three hours of playing it, this is already the best $30 I've spent in awhile. Keep it up workshop community!

Call of duty black ops 3 is split into 3 main parts which are Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies. Starting with campaign it is awful. First the campaign does not have any thing to do with the 2 previous black ops games. It makes no sense and the missions are a huge let down of what they could be. Multiplayer is decent. Multiplayer in BO3 gives you an element of fun with the wall running and jump boosts. In my opinion the futuristic style of multiplayer is not that bad since it is well balanced compared to Advanced warfare and Infinite warfare. However, a lot of the DLC weapons are the top guns in the game which would be fine if you could actually earn them. But. you cant it is very rare you can get a contract to open a case for a DLC weapon and the only other way to get the weapons with a high chance is paying a lot of money towards boxes. It would be better if the cases were kept to cosmetic only so everyone could earn the guns they want. But overall the multiplayer is a fun thing to play every now and again. Where do i start with zombies. Zombies is Amazing. In zombies you can have the original BO3 maps like Shadows of evil which are great maps. Then you have the option to buy the Zombies chronicles map pack which gives you Shi no Numa, Origins, Nacht der Untoten, Shangri-la, Moon, Ascension, Kino der Toten and Verruckt. All of these maps create the best zombies expierence to date. All of these maps give you such variety to make the best Black ops zombie game. Lastly, custom zombies. What an amazing thing to add it gives you even more of a choice of fun maps to play with your friends as well as mod packs for weapons which can give that element of fun when playing zombies. So overall you should buy this game just for the zombies in my opinion this is the best call of duty game to play zombies, Not only that the multiplayer is not awful but can do with some work so its a thumbs up from me.

At the moment as it stands I cannot play this game.  If I restart my PC I can play zombies for about 10 minutes before it crashes out, process terminated, no error.  After that the game will not launch (process flashes on and then off) until I restart my PC again.  This makes me think it has something to do with virtual memory as I have found a number of "fixes" referring to it, however, I have not found a fix yet.  Before anyone mentions, yes my PC meets the specs.

---EDIT---

Finally got this game to run after the 3rd "clean restart".  I still have no idea what the route cause is and I don't have the patience to eliminate things to find out right now.  I love this game and for 80%+ off the original price I may have minded less all the digging through the internet to figure this out.  As it stands, however, I cannot recommend a game with such glaring issues that the developers knew about and couldn't seem to be bothered to fix.

Definitely my favorite call of duty. 
Pros-
---nuketown 
---very fluid movement , jumping and boosting feels so natural and adds so much more speed and skill to the game (in tdm most cods have 75 be the goal but in bo3 it's 100 because the everything moves faster, thanks to the jetpack)
---a great connection and high fps rate usually 
---there are 6 modes to play: campaign, multiplayer, zombies, freerun (short 'how to use the jetpack' tutorial stages) , nightmare, and dead ops arcade
---a variety of camos and outfits for you to personalize your gun and character. (camos earned one mode can be worn on another, applicable to campaign, multiplayer, and zombies)
---the zombies mode is amazingly well done and there are 14 unique cannon maps to play (if you buy all the dlc)
---mods are available and there are tons of them

Cons-
---the community 
---lots of modders in multiplayer 
---the campaign story is weird, but if you really look into it it makes sense... somewhat 
---a LOT of grinding is required to get all the achievements
---practically impossible to complete all the games challenges since they require you to win in different multiplayer game modes but everyone only plays tdm

The button that says green "play" to gray "playing" goes back to green "play"


After spending several days, most of my time on those days too, I did everything I could and the problem still occurs. I have a MSI GT76 Titan, brand new, gaming laptop worth 4 grand+ or $4,000+ (perfect laptop for hardcore and serious gaming) so the problem is not my laptop. The problem is the game. It's meant to be on PS3, PS4, Xbox 1 only. I have no freaking idea how it's working to half of the people who bought this game on PC but it strictly and specifically does NOT WORK for me like it has some kind of grudge against me as an individual.


I'm gonna issue a refund. The game itself is perfect for zombies so if it works fine for you, keep it. If you're experiencing auto closing crash problems like me, refund it ASAP.

Literally best game in existence, no cap. Campaign - kinda weird but still fun with mates and overall not a bad experience, you do not buy this game for the campaign. Multiplayer - Literally the best multiplayer out of any call of duty, 2nd to black ops 2 maybe, I have almost master prestige (stopped prestige for a while to try dark matter) and still enjoy playing matches to this almost 5 years after the game's release. Zombies - The best zombies experience out of any call of duty, hands down... it is so in-depth with the bosses and mini-bosses, pack-a-punched guns, and unique map orientated guns, with each easter egg feeling completely different depending on the map your on. I have not spent too long on the campaign but have over 4 days on playtime on multiplayer and 2 days on zombies. It is definitely worth a buy and if you and a couple of friends get it, you will play this game up to 2025. If you get it on pc, you can also use custom maps on zombies and multiplayer to extend the lifetime of the game for you.

(TLDR at end) BO3 is probably one of my favourites out of the series, not just for the zombies (which is what a good percentage of all players still play it for) but also just how smoothly the game plays and how good it looks. The mechanics (ie enhanced movement) are nice and easy to get used to, but not easy to master as well, which can often times scare other players off. 

The multiplayer is still fairly populated, and can be fun at times, but the enhanced movement can get annoying with players flying up and down while you try to shoot them. The microtransactions w/lootboxes are another greedy way to get money in my eyes, and I don't quite appreciate it. 

The zombies mode is the pinnacle of what the series has hoped to achieve, with a massive fanbase, tons of maps and a seemingly endless replayability factor, the entire mode is perfect. 

The campaign isn't the best, story-wise, as it is confusing, and kicks you in the head at the very end of it. The implementation of the advanced weaponry and battlefield view seems OP in my opinion.

TLDR: 
Multiplayer: 7.5/10
Zombies: 9.5/10
Campaign: 4/10
Overall for what you get: 8/10

My personal favourite Call of Duty game, if you're buying it now do it for Campaign or Zombies.

The campaign, while extremely divisive and controversial, is in my book one of the most engaging and thrilling stories ever told in this series. It's not like Modern Warfare where there are explosions in your face 24/7 and ridiculously huge scale events going on all the time. This story is thought provoking, disturbing, gritty and actually has characters I give a shit about. While it has very little to do with the original Black Ops games, it's still a gem in a sea of forgettable campaigns this series has had (Looking at you COD WWII).

Zombies is likely what everyone is buying this game for now, and I can't blame them. BO3 has the best zombies the series has ever had, with a total of 14 maps to play on. You get 5 original maps with 9 remakes, and they are all a joy to play on. The original cast of Richtofen, Takeo, Dempsey, and especially Nikolai still make me laugh, and the maps will hold you forever. There's also custom zombies which is pretty hit or miss, but can bring you a lot of fun if you know where to look. Don't worry about population, you'll pretty much always find a game if you're in a dense area (NA East), if not, there are places to find players everywhere.

Multiplayer has passed its heyday, and to-date has one of the worst microtransaction systems I've ever seen in a multiplayer FPS. That still didn't prevent me from sinking serious hours into it. The map design is great, the weapons are creative, the specialists are all unique, it looks gorgeous, and there is so much stuff to unlock and have fun with. Sadly my favourite maps are all in the season pass, which you'll never get to play since no one plays them anymore. I feel privileged to have experienced the beauty of Spire, Knockout, and Empire. I'm so glad they got rid of the season pass in Modern Warfare, along with the supply drops, that plague this game. Weapons are locked behind supply drops, not just melee weapons, but genuine fan favourites like the M16, Galil, Famas and countless others. It's disgusting and taints this once beautiful mode. Don't bother playing multiplayer now, but it used to be something great.

Call of Duty¬Æ: Black Ops III is the definitive CoD zombies game on the market. It had Shadows of evil and The Giant as launch maps (The Giant is a 5 euro map). Both were great map with Shadows being a bit more complex than The Giant but great nonetheless. Its first DLC map was Der Eisendrache (The Iron Dragon) witch is a banger with zombies content creators having it be in they're top 5 favorite maps of all time (Honestly staffs where better than bows dont @ me). Second map 3arch made was Zetsubou No Shima (Island of Despair) and its the only map that bombed. Its entire set up process is mind-numbing boring (only good thing that ZNS did was adding the marshals and razorback). 3rd and my personal favorite map is Gorod Krovi (city of blood) WITCH HAS DRAGONS! Who in they're right mind doesn't like dragons? Also ray gun MK3 and THE GLORIOUS SOVIET HAND CRAFTED  PPSH-41 CHAMBERED IN STALIN APROVED 7.62x25mm. And last but not least Revelations and it was a collage of old maps. Quite disappointing for some, but i am nostalgic for it since i waited weeks to play it and i got sick so i had to stay at home and then i played the everloving crap out of this map. The easter egg was quite disappointing aswell but u can get a apothicon serpent from the box witch is good for people how didnt do the easter egg for Shadows of Evil (me). There is also a 5th dlc that i wont write here since im gonna make a seprate review on its store page called Zombies Chronicles and it is a must buy if u like the other Cod Zombies maps. Also BO3 has custom zombie maps that are really well made and free (personal recommendations are Rust, Dome, Terminal and Town since they work great with the UGX gun game mod).

I recommend this, but only from nostalgia and playing with friends. Also, grab it on sale or from a key site. Don't give your money to Activision. That being said, take a look below for more.

Campaign: TL DR; Wasn't great not the worst though, inventive game play, but a mishmash feeling to it. Like a glorified tech demo.

The Long Version:
The Campaign isn't great, its playable and has multiplayer, which i'm assuming would be more fun, but my friends wont play it, so not available from my perspective. But from the levels I did play, both on console and PC, its playable, and can be enjoyable, just not my cup of tea. (For Context, I loved the AW campaign, It felt more *solid*)

Multiplayer: TL DR; Still fun, but not very populated. Play BO2 and find an unhacked lobby, its worth the wait.

Long Version
I've played every COD since BO2, while my personal favorite gameplay was AW, BO3 felt more refined, but the massive amount of micro-transaction BS they force into the menus makes it a very hard game to pickup, its overwhelming at best, and a complete turn-off at worst. As well, there is no way to transfer data if you played on PS4 or XBOX previously, having played on PS4 and putting *quite* a high amount of time in, I unlocked a solid 2% of the games cosmetics, It would've been nice to use them here, where the game is still playable with fresh content thanks to the modding community.

Zombies: TL DR; Not BO2, but beats BO4. (Didnt play BO1)
Long Version
Second favorite zombies experiences to date, movement is smooth, zombies are freaky, and the maps are phenomenal (Not Zetsubo, we dont talk about that map)
Continuing from where origins left off in the giant, and continuing the mob storyline with shadows of evil, (which does tie into the origins timeline after the EE) you get the one shadows experience with the game, and its the only map from BO3 that requires 4 players to complete the easter egg, so it does feel kind of weak. but all of the DLC, with the exception of DLC 2, are worth it. Even if the story did end kind of weakly. Its still a very satisfying gameplay, which can be done by yourself, or with friends. Its much better with friends.

TL DR; Its a bland game, that's kept alive by fond memories of playing it, as well as the mods that you can get from the workshop. But if this is your first, or at least your first on PC, skip it.

Wow, this is the best Call of Duty in the franchise, in my opinion.

Treyarch did an amazing job with both the Zombies and Multiplayer modes. People may argue that Activision adding in supply drops is a move to make money, but I'm perfectly fine with it. Activision is a company that does need funds to continue to create and publish these games, plus you can get supply drops by actually playing Multiplayer.

The DLC maps, for Zombies, in particular, were amazing in my opinion. Treyarch made five challenging, fun, and replayable maps for the community, and they swung it out of the park. You may call me a fanboy of this franchise or this game in particular and all I have to say back is, play the Zombies mode.

Shadows of Evil brings an interesting turn to the Zombies storyline by introducing our four main characters to creatures named the Keepers and the Apothicons.

Der Eisendrache brings us a hint and 'flashback' to a loved map, Origins. You go through four different challenges to upgrade four different bows similar to the four staffs in origins.

Zetsubou No Shima, even though it isn't a community favorite, brought a challenging but simple easter egg to add on to the Zombies storyline.

Gorod Krovi, another community favorite, reveals the secrets still left behind the now known Doctor Monty and brings back the memories of past characters in previous zombies maps.

Revelations, the ending. This map received a lot of criticism from the community like not having the stuff on the map, not having a longer cutscene, and many more reasons. But all criticism behind, it was an amazing ending to the greatest story ever created in a side game mode.

Treyarch recently released a new 'Zombies Chronicles' DLC and it just made this game even better. They've brought back and remastered the most loved eight maps and new incredible Gobble Gums into this already amazing game.

Honestly, the zombies mode carries this entire game. The campaign is the worst in the series and the multiplayer is not that fun to play. Zombies, however, is a different story. The map that comes on disc, Shadows of Evil, is a masterpiece. Include the DLCs and you've got a massive collection of fan favorite maps.
don't lose hope in this game, for better experience try the game workshop.

This review is mainly for the zombies as I'm not a huge multiplayer fan.

MULTIPLAYER

 That doesn't mean the multiplayer is bad however. It's fast, leaves a lot of ways to outplay your opponent all with that cood style gameplay we all know. Its movement system, albeit good, is kinda like titanfall's but not as cleanly added. 

ZOMBIES

This is probably the best zombies in the Treyarch lineup, although only by a little. This is coming from someone who has played every single zombies map (Most on an xbox 360) and loved all of them. Mechanically, The new features in the zombies is the sliding and gobblegums. The sliding, when mastered, is a great way to get around without stamin-up which is great as some of the maps are pretty big. Gobblegums are a mixed bag for me. Don't get me wrong, I love them. They make easter eggs and high rounds really easy, but thats also why they're a problem. Since you can pay for packs of gobblegums they become a sort of pay-to-win mechanic. Although, you're not really playing against other people and you don't have to use them. This still inflates the leader board though. Shadows of Evil is one of my favorite maps of all time, Great PAP quest, great weapons, great wonder weapon, great side easter eggs, and great main easter eggs. The theme and music is absolutly stunning. It is a bit hard for newer players but I'm sure they'll get around to it eventually. Der Eisendrache (or however you spell"The Iron Dragon" in German) is looked upon as one of the greatest maps of all time and while I'm not quite as in love with it, I still love it. Great Wonder weapon and Wonder weapon quests, great layout and theme, great boss, and great easter egg. A perfect map for beginners. Zetsubo no shima is considered to be the worst of the bunch but it is by no means bad. Its got an interesting mechanic of watering plants every round with specific types of water to produce some really crazy results. Its wonder weapon is a little derivative but still good. Its easter egg is alright and even has a pretty cool boss fight. Although the best part of this map is its creepy, unsettling atmosphere. Gorod Krovi is another fan favorite. Its very reminicent of older maps as it brought back the ppsh and the PAP isn't that hard to get to. The easter egg is a kinda hard so watch out on that but overall the map is great. Revelations has gotten flak for just being a giant hodge podge of parts of other maps but that doesn't mean it isn't good. It brings back the SOE Wonder Weapon and the Thunder gun but unfortunately doesn't have any new ones. There is a lot to do, side easter eggs and such, which is good as I personally enjoy that stuff. The PAP quest was actually pretty cool and I enjoy doing it everytime. Overall a pretty good map. 

What really tops this game off is the mod tools that come with it. This allows people to make their own multiplayer, and more importanty, zombie maps that you can download off the workshop. The whole map creation is really confising personally but ill get it eventually. 


TL/DR 
The multiplayer is alright. The zombies is the best. Custom zombies exists, and its really good.

I'll be straight up. I would only purchase this game if you are heavily interested in Zombies and completing Easter Eggs. If that is you, I think you will have a fantastic time. I personally got the Zombies Chronicles Deluxe Edition for 100 US Dollars, and I will admit that the price seems rather steep for a game that came out in 2015. Hopefully I can describe my experience well enough to determine whether or not it's an experience that matches that price tag. 

[h1] FINDING PLAYERS [/h1] 
First of all, I think it's important to state that it is not easy to find public lobbies to play Zombies. If I queued for a public match on a map that was not Origins, Shadows Of Evil(the base map), or Der Eisendrache(first DLC), it was very unlikely that I would find another player at all, and if I did it would be someone in Europe with no mic, meaning it would be a very poor gameplay experience. Worry not, for there are still people out there playing this game, I just had to locate them manually. I had to join about 3 different discords and constantly look for players about an hour before I found players on PC that were willing to play with me. Despite the difficulty of initially locking down players, typically they will have the same goals as yourself and willing to stick around and play more in the future. Overall, I would say that one would have a very tough time playing this game if they're unable to network around a bit and make groups to get things done.

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
It's Zombies, and it is some damn fine Call of Duty Zombies if I've ever seen it. Having not played much Zombies since the initial release of Origins on BO2, I came into the game just wanting to experience the maps that I had literally no knowledge about before loading in. In general the gameplay is much more complicated than anything before, basically forcing the player to complete quests that involve the entire map in order to acquire powerful weapons to get you through higher rounds. Some of them are a wee bit too tedious for my liking, but add an interesting wrinkle to the gameplay that helps with the monotony of killing zombies round after round. There's also a lot more "boss" zombies and monsters that occasionally fill into your hordes, that are for the most part well balanced compared to the rewards you receive for killing them. They also add another section to the learning curve, giving you one more skill to perfect as you keep playing through the maps.

[h1]MAPS[/h1]
Keeping it spoiler free as to the context of the maps and their conclusions, I must state that I am in love with the maps that you receive for buying the Deluxe Chronicles version of Black Ops 3. They all feature intense learning curves in finding all the landmarks and other relevant locations, as well as finding the best training and general rotations around the place. Some of the maps feature skill curves as well where your general sense as a zombies player isn't necessarily enough to tackle some of the end-game content and requires a lot of trial and error to perfect. The Easter Eggs are well designed and doable for the average player, as long as they take the time to learn the steps and not die in the process.

[h1]MODS[/h1]
I personally was surprised to find that there is a massive amount of custom zombies content in the workshop for this game, whether it be replacing player models with Kermit the Frog or having an entire map based around the player sitting in a bathroom stall while the zombies charge at them, there's lots of variety and new stuff is coming out all the time. As a modded experience Black Ops 3 only expands in value for me and makes the community for this game feel alive despite the empty public lobbies.

[h1]OTHER MODES[/h1]
I tried the campaign, and I was asleep by the second mission, and the weird game mechanics like wall running have kept me away from multiplayer altogether, so I can't offer a full opinion on them, but I felt like the zombies was more than enough content for myself to enjoy.

[h1]FINAL THOUGHTS[/h1]
I purchased and downloaded this game on April 6th, 2020, and completed all of the Easter Eggs in the non-Chronicles Maps by April 17th. This game completely engrossed me in all its content and I'm excited to get to the other maps and explore what they have for me. It's not very often I pick up a game with completely empty public lobbies and no more developer support and play 10+ hours a day because that's what I want to do. I do understand that $100 is an enormously steep price tag, but there's so much offered in this game that for some it makes up for it's lack of price drop. If at any point it goes on sale, I would say this game is an instant pick-up, but for the time being, I would just determine how valuable zombies is to you.

The negative rating has mostly to do  with the issue im having at Zombies and also a little bit with Multiplayer.

Zombies  
- This was the main reason why i purchased this game. I really love the story behind every map and doing the Easter Eggs. At the moment i cant play this mode anymore because of an lobby issue that im having. 

When i join a group of random players, the Ready Up button doesnt respond. When i host a public match, players cant Ready Up and i get delayed lobby messages.
When i try to host a private match it immediately kicks me out of Zombies and back to the main screen.
Before this problem occurred i didnt had any problems and everything worked fine until now. Also ive been playing this game for years with the same Internet connection and settings.

This is by the way the second time that im having this problem. Somehow when it happened the first time it fixed it self.

Campaign 
- This was also one of the main reasons why i purchased this game. I really like the gameplay and to me the  the story is really great . You will experience some bugs from time to time when playing this mode.
In my opinion this is one of the best Call of Duty campaign out there.

Multiplayer

While I do recommend the game, it's most fun with friends. Campaign is a joke, but its co-op. Multiplayer is ehh, but its more fun with friends. Zombies is where this game truly shines, its fun solo, but its more fun with friends.

The Campaign is pretty crap, doesn't connect at all to the previous campaigns (apart from a few small mentions) and doesn't feel as fun. No wonder it's the least completed campaign in COD history.

The multiplayer is hit or miss. Either you love the advanced movement, or you hate it. You aren't really likely to find many games nowadays however.

The zombies is where this game truly shines. Each of the maps is crafted with so much love and care, Treyarch even decided to bring back a bunch of BO1 maps in 'Zombie Chronicles' as well as Origins for those who played BO2. Black Ops 3 maps are a lot more complex and difficult to set up on than any previous game, but once you've actually set up, it is fairly easy to survive. Each map is unique, has a unique setting, and provides a unique gameplay experience. Easter eggs are prevelant, like always, but they're a lot harder this time around. You'll have to practice. The Zombie Chronicles remasters were incredibly effective at bringing a last gen level into next gen, (Shangri-La is my personal favourite, design wise), and they all still feel just as fun and distinct as they did in Black Ops 1 or 2.

Overall, if you have friends, who are rich, get this game.

The tl;dr is that Black Ops 3 has good gameplay, but terrible storytelling, and the multiplayer map design isn't all that good.

- The campaign for this game is an absolute mess. The first mistake is the lack of a real protagonist, just some soulless vessel named "Player" (something along those lines, I haven't played the story in forever). Everything after that is bad writing. For the optimal story experience, go look up the fan theory online, involving the player being on their deathbed reliving Taylor's memories. Obviously this is just a theory and not part of the game, so I still can't say that it's good.

- Multiplayer is good, save for the terrible, overpowered specialists and the usual 3-lane map design. The weapons are nothing to write home about, but they function, which is all you can really hope for nowadays.

- Black Ops 3 is arguably the peak of Zombies. Both the workshop and official maps are pretty good. If nothing else, buy this game for Zombies (it's the only mode I actually have installed onto my hard drive atm). The storytelling is admittedly all over the place. Seriously, the writing quality severely plummeted once Origins happened. The Primis crew is well written and their growth throughout the course of the story is endearing, but the overarching plot is the most nonsensical thing ever. But the gameplay is still the best it's ever been for zombies.

- There are also a few bonus modes. Nightmares, which is basically the campaign all over again, but there's an actual protagonist, the levels are reordered, and there are zombies + the mystery box + powerups. Dead Ops Arcade 2 is a thing, and is still as good as always. And finally there's the underappreciated Freerun mode, which uses Black Ops 3's movement system to it's fullest, it's a shame there aren't more maps beyond the main 4.

- Finally there's the Black Market, which has lootboxes, with weapons in them. Enough said.

So in conclusion Black Ops 3 is all around a meh game. The storytelling is terrible but everything else is worth checking out, Zombies especially. The Black Market is trash though.

Edit: Removed the Black Ops 4 rant and removed other elements. The main review was still left intact.

Call of duty black ops 3 was a pretty good game back when it first came out but after a few years it doesn't get played as much as it did. I'll break it down to you on what is good and what is bad (this is my opinion about the game so don't hate.) Lets start with the campaign, the campaign for this call of duty wasn't the best as there was a lot of things that didn't get explained and the characters to me felt more robotic then human but it still had some interesting parts. The part that I hate the most was the second mission. What was probably 20 minutes felt like a hour just to finish it but it was needed if you didn't start with the multiplayer to see how the game feels and how it moves. Next lets go to the multiplayer, I think this was the start of the pay to win systems in Cod as you would spend 100 maybe thousands of dollars just trying to unlock one of the new guns that might be one shot kill or a gun that takes a couple of shots to kill someone but was annoying to go up against. Last lets talk about Zombies, I would have to say that Zombies was one of the best things in this game as each DLC they brought out felt like a completely new map. The only DLC I would suggest not to get is the second DLC as it wasn't a great map and the new wonder weapon they brought to it was trash. They best thing is even if you get bored with the maps they brought out there is a steam workshop so you can get custom maps and you'll be surprised on how good some of the maps can be. This is a game I would suggest for you to get as it can be a fun game.

*I personally only play zombies myself nowadays with the COD Black ops series* but if youre a cod zombies fan this has all that you'll need to enjoy the good ol days with the remasters or enjoy the new series of maps including the community made; workshop maps. I will forever keep this installed on my pc for as long as it works ;)
ONLY BECAUSE OF ZOMBIES: BEST GAME OF ALL TIME IN MY OPINION! OF ANY GAME! AND THIS IS COMING FROM SOMEONE WHO COULDN'T EVEN PLAY BO4... BO3 IS AN ABSOLUTE MASTERPIECE!!!!

If you buy this game for anything other than Zombies, you're doing it wrong.

Campaign isn't that good and Multiplayer is completely dead (I can't find a single game), so your only real option here is Zombies. But, I'd say that makes up for everything else because Black Ops III Zombies is outstanding.

The map you get by default, Shadows of Evil, is amazing. It has so much depth but even as a newer player, you don't need to know how to do everything to have a fun time with the map. If you want to spend some extra cash for the DLCs, I'm very confident that they're all worth it except for Zetsubou No Shima. It's just a very tedious map and it's the worst one of the bunch.

However, every other map is totally worth picking up. Definitely recommend this game to any Zombies player who hasn't played it yet.

UPDATE: Recently the games multiplayer matchmaking has ceased working, with or without DLC. Avoid until this has been rectified.

This review is based on the impulse purchase I made, because I really wanted to get back into the Multiplayer TDM's of COD that are always so popular. I originally purchased BO4 and game to find out that their TDM is more like Rainbow Six: Siege in the idea that you get one life and that you need to eliminate the enemy team, and it just wasn't cutting it for me.

After getting that refunded, I did my research on BO3 and found out through SteamCharts that it does have a decently sized playerbase (in accordance to bo4, WW and MW being out). I logged immediately into the Multiplayer and got right into a game, it was great!

However, all that fun came to an end after that match. Everyone had left that lobby so I searched for a new match to no avail. It was switching between finding 50 lobbies and zero. To pass the time, thinking I was maybe just at that time where people arn't really online, I played campaign. I would stop playing it every hour or so to see if I could get into a lobby and the same occurrence would happen, no lobbies. I used the "search" option to try to find a server. There was one open, it was a ffa, 6 players and they were all bots but for 2 guys and it was a strange server, in the sense that nobody could die, but you could if shot by an actual player and not a bot, but you couldnt even differentiate who was a bot and who wasn't because nobody was talking.

I continued to try to find a multiplayer lobby over the 2 days I've had this game and I haven't gotten into a single one since that first one. I'm sure the game was fun back when it had a player base, but it definitely doesn't anymore. I personally think their $60 price tag should be dropped down to at least $30, but Treyarch isn't known for doing that. If you want the campaign, although I dont think the cost fits, buy the game. if you want it to get multiplayer but not the kind that BO4 offers, then do not purchase this. You will not find a lobby unless you play the game with friends.

I figured that i should update this review after the releases of other COD games. So, i will finally give my in-depth review on this game. Nearly four years overdue, but still well deserved.

To start with, the campaign is... confusing. I didn't understand it at all until i looked it up. To be deadly honest, the campaign is easily the weakest part of this game. It has little to no relation to the former Black Ops games. I have not played them, but I know their campaigns. After this, it is no shock that Black Ops 4 didn't have a campaign, but that isn't what I am reviewing today. If you want a story, this isn't the game for you. While i appreciate the thoughts behind it and the complexity behind it, it was poorly executed.

Moving on to the Multiplayer, i couldn't play too much of it due to its... issues. The Black Market is a shady marketing practice that i dont think should be incorporated into future games. The weapons in them mostly ruin the balance of the game. On the plus side, it is still possible to compete in the multiplayer with out it. Well... if the multiplayer was still alive. From my experience, it took me 4 hours to get into one match... only to be obliterated. The core multiplayer is fun if you have friends to do custom with. Most people dislike the enhanced movement, but I personally enjoy it.

Finally, we move on to the Zombies. To me, this is the best part of the game. Custom maps and mods increase the lifespan of most of the game. However, i would rather review the official maps. Shadows of Evil is a great map to get started on. While it is complex, the style of it is one of the most unique of the entire COD franchise. It is a great map, but difficult for new players to start on. All of the DLC maps fall under this list, excluding Zombies Chronicles and The Giant. 

Speaking of Zombies DLC, Zombies Chronicles was a shock to many player and was a remaster of eight different maps. As a fan of zombies, i just HAD to get a hold of it and i wasn't dissapointed. In regards to zombies, this is the best zombies mode in ANY COD game. The Aether story is wrapped up here for the most part, only to be made more confused by BO4. 

There is much more, but i was trying to keep my review brief. I am not a professional critic, but i feel like this is a basis for you gamers out there. If you are a fan of campaigns, steer clear. If you have friends for Multiplayer, go for it but wait for the sale or something. However, if you are a Zombies fan, then this game is a MUST. The DLC are amazing and the community will always keep it alive. Well, use this as you will

I have bought this game on three platforms. I have over 1500 hours logged across all three. I reached prestige master on multiplayer. That was a load of fun. Zombies on the other hand, was absolutely amazing. I have most of my game time on zombies. I've completed all of the easter eggs, reached round 105 on Der Eisendrache. I love the core characters so much as I've been with them for day one. If you like zombies, then you're in for a treat. Yes I would recommend this game.

I've played both ps4 and pc and I only mainly play for zombies but I have played the other modes.

Campaign  3/10: I like the abilities and how you can use your own guns. However, the story is absolute s**t. I just skip the cutscene because it was so boring, and there's poor character development. There is co-op though which is pretty fun with a friend, but other than that campaign is BO3 weakpoint.

Multiplayer  7/10: It's a big grind. Like every other games nowadays, there's microtransaction and you can pay to get better guns. Some of the guns are okay, but some are just stupidly good. The maps imo are decent, and they fit well with all the jumping and wall riding. You're either in a lobby with lots of sweats or just some people who want to chill (from my experience). Customization is alright, but the specialist abilities. Even though rewarding, is just really annoying and not what COD is suppose to be. Once you get some good guns, and grind. Multiplayer becomes pretty fun to play.

Zombies  10/10: So much content. Literally all the BO3 zombies map and chronicles are amazing to play. The 4 DLC maps are all fun and look amazing. All have their own unique EE and wonder weapons. The chronicles expansion is an absolute throwback with some of Zombies OG maps such as all the WAW maps, moon, origins, Kino, and more. The gobblegums tbh are absolutely gamebreaking. There's one gobblegum that basically makes you invincible. Me personally, I think the gobblegums are really fun to use, and it made what was impossible in Zombies possible. One thing that cought my attention was custom zombie maps. It is f***ing fun af especially with a friend. Treyarch did a really good job in BO3 zombies as I personally think it's slightly better than BO1 zombies. 

Conclusion: There's plenty of content in BO3 which will never make you bored of this game. 5 years later, and this game is still enjoyable to play.

Pretty much a purely Zombies perspective. This game is awesome for people who loves the zombies mode. So many maps. Most of the new ones are just awesome and the old ones like the Giant and the Zombies Chronicles are faithful remasters with updated features from Black Ops 3. Assuming you have all the DLC you can get so much mileage out of it. Like a simple experience? Kino, Acension, The Giant, Nacht, Gorod Krovi even. Something more complicated? Shadows, Der Eisendrache, Origins. Something for everyone. Microtransactions with gobblegums are semi-annoying, but they honestly implemented in such a way that I don't really feel like its an issue. Through normal gameplay I've gotten plenty of Divinium for the factory and I'm comfortable using a few Megas here and there when I feel like it. Even just the normal gobblegums have enough use that you don't really need megas anyways most of the time. Overall, probably the best COD Zombies game ever so far. The pure quality and quantity is unrivaled. BO4 was a big disappointment for me and probably the first time I've ever fully regretted the purchase of a game. BO3 is the opposite. It's what zombies should be for the most part. BO1 and BO2 had their own merits, but come nowhere near the level of pure content on offer here.

This is by far my all time favorite Call of Duty. The exhilarating gameplay spans across all three aspects of the game (Campaign, Multiplayer, Zombies).  I have played this game across a couple of accounts so the hours played at this time are not indicative of the time that I have spent playing this incredible experience (2,100 hours in total).  I will be analyzing each aspect of the game and going over the pros and cons of each.

[h1]Campaign[/h1]
I don't really get the negative light that this campaign received.  As long as you seperate this campaign from the campaigns of the first black ops games, I personally think that this is not bad.  It can be very confusing if you don't pay attention and even then I had to look up videos on YouTube to figure out what exactly was going on.

Rating: 6/10

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
There really isn't much to say about the multiplayer here. I mostly come back to it because of the jetpack/parkour aspect of the game. There's something really satisfying about headshoting someone just after running on a wall suspended over canyons.  It really isn't active however; I usually run into the same 50-100 people on a given day and it has sort of become a community of the same people and I like that. It has personally been my favorite multiplayer experience

Rating: 8/10

[h1]Zombies[/h1]
THIS. IS. THE. BEST. EXPERIENCE. I'VE. HAD. WITH. ZOMBIES. EVER.

Each map is unique in it's own way, with its own twists and turns, Pack-a-Punch weapons and  new characters to enjoy; With celebrity cameos and new secrets to unlock, these base maps are incredible to play and a look at.  That's just the new maps.  Zombie Chronicles releases with many old school maps to deliver a nostalgic tone to the new age of call of duty zombies.

Rating: 10/10

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
This is a great experience if you love zombies mode, but if you are looking for a multiplayer experience, I would suggest you look elsewhere. It won't be long before there isn't anyone in the servers

Total Rating: 8/10

Hola to the few random people scrolling down into the comments and reviews. Im home from school today so ive decided to write a review on one of my favorite games. Im gonna be breaking this review up into different categories on the three main gameplays and the bonus ones, Zombies, Multiplayer, Campaign and the Bonus mode. Also i just hit my 300th hour on the game so i think im somewhat qualified to talk about this game. Also this is my first review so i would appreciate some criticism

Zombies:

1.) Gameplay
Call of Duty Black Ops is notorious for zombies, they revolutionized with every new installment and took a different turn with the release of Black Ops 3. Black Ops 3 included two new main additions that carried over with every map (Gobblegum, and Double Pack a Punch) and each map had their own unique features. Gobblegum was a contreversial addition for the reason most people thought it made the game "too easy" and wasnt necessary but i beg to differ. Gobblegum adds another path to take with the game, another way to approach your run. You could either play without the gums that carry you throughout the experience or you could do my personal favorite and complete the easter eggs in 1hr. Moving on to the next addition, Double Pack a Punch. Pack a Punch was a staple of all zombies and treyarch took a turn and said "Lets make it even better". DPP allowed for infinite damage making high rounds attempts effortless and much faster inscentivizing the player to continue playing and trying out different abilities that best suite their gameplay style.

2.) Map Design

The map design of every map is similar in the fact that you can go either left or right to reach your objective. Like i mentioned before each map has its own unique features. For example, Gorod Krovi, my personal favorite. This map has Dragons, Manglers, Drones, More dragons, Robots, Drunk Russian, and a Flying Eyeball? And thats barely scratching the surface. You dont need to be a veteran to understand or interact with the features of the map.

3.) Easter Eggs

Every game has their own little easter eggs that you can do to maybe get a secret weapon or some bonus currency but Black Ops 3 says "Fuck you, look at what i can do" Every "DLC" map offers some sort of easter egg that you want to do. Shadows of Evil or commonly seen as SoE, is the base map, the one that everyone starts off with. This is a four player easter egg and the objective here is to defeat the "Shadow Man", repent for your sins, and obtain the "summoning key". You have to perform for rituals, collect souls, get a sword, kill "Margwas" which are based off of HP Lovecrafts Cthulu Mythos. Then after that you have to defend a flag while meatballs go at it at full speed. Then the final step is a bossfight with the shadowman himself. You pour 100's of bullets into him hoping to defeat him only to fail and have to try again. The easter eggs are so interesting and each deliver some sort of small message to the player. 

4.) The Story

The story is by far one of the most interesting stories ive seen in a videogame which is saying a lot. This story isnt some carbon copy thats used in every game, its its own new idea that Jason Blundell made and a story that i think everyone can appreciate. The four main characters are Takeo, a japenese warrior that cares only about honer, Dempsey, who loves to tell you to drop the chips, Richtofen, basically hitler if he was a scientist, and Nikolai, who is on his ninth wife. These heros go around from dimension to dimension attempting to restore reality.

5.) Replayability

Yes. This game keeps you coming back for more. You always want to improve your time in easter eggs, always want to find out how to optimize certain routes and wanting to go for higher rounds. If you get really good at the game you also can join multiple discord to help people that just started.

6.) Cons

Zombies is an overall great experience but not everything is perfect. One major downside of zombies are the graphics in some areas of maps. Sometimes a map will look phenomenal but then you move 5 feet to the right and it looks like a potato. Another BS thing in some maps are the dumbass mini bosses that come every few rounds, tedious easter egg steps and Zetsubou.

7.) Final Verdict

Call of Duty Zombies is amazing, i didnt mention custom zombies because thats not part of the main game like what treyarch made, thats more community fueled. I would recommend this game to everyone for its great story, good graphics, and overall fun gameplay. Its fun on your own but even better with friends, granted it has its flaws but what game doesnt?

Multiplayer

1.) Gameplay

Me personally, im not a fan of Bo3 multiplayer. Its super pay to win so in any encounter whoever has the better gun will win. This is a lot less skill based and the meta rarely changes. You could call me bad at the game and i would accept that but there are a lot of over-powered weapons that really ruin the experience. But one "new" addition to the Black Ops series was Rocket Jump/Boost. If you double tap space bar you can fly up for a short time, the downside of this is it makes noise and alerts others to your position.

2.) Map Layout

There isnt much really to say about this since every map is mostly formatted the same way. There are two lanes, one on the left and right and there's a middle part with some obstacles on all three paths. Your spawn changes throughout the game to prevent spawn camping and most maps have a window in the middle to camp in.

3.) Specialists

One new addition that was in Bo3's multiplayer was the ability to have specialists. Specialists each grant you and ability that fills up throughout the game. With each specialist you can choose between one of two abilities, usually one passive and one that more for attack. You can also customize the appearance of your specialists with crates that come from the black market which i'll talk more about later.

4.) Black Market

The Black Market is how you get cosmetics and DLC weapons. You can either spend money to earn crates faster or you can just do missions and play a lot. You can win either common, rare, epic, and legendary. You can get emotes, skins, camos, paintjobs and emblems.

5.) Final Verdict

Multiplayer is personally not my favorite but ive heard mixed review on it. You can load into a game and have the best time of your life destroying everyone else in the lobby, or you can get unlucky and walk into a prestige master level 1000 and start throwing things. If you get Bo3 i would still recommend giving multiplayer a try, maybe thats your style or what youre good at.

Campaign

1.) Gameplay

The campaign is the worst out of all of the Black Ops, granted thats purely subjective but its just bad. The only positive thing i can mention about it is that its fun to screw around with it but only with friends. The bots are super easy to kill unless youre playing realistic, theirs no incentive to go for collectibles, class selection and loadout is pointless because it takes so long to level up your guns.

2.) Story

Horrible. Just bad. I couldnt follow it at all and honestly i just couldnt give a crap about any of the characters involved. The person you play as isnt likeable and isnt relatable. And i gave the story a try but i couldnt follow it, there are just too many things going on.

3.) Map Design

The map design is different every time but the layout is the same. Theres an open area outside the you go inside, the after that you have to go outside again, maybe take control of some robot then go back inside just to go outside again. 

4.) Final Verdict

I dont mean to cut this short but i reached the world limit lmao. Overall Bo3 is an amazing experience and i would recommend this to literally everyone to give it a shot. If you made it this far, thank you and i would appreciate some criticism on my review. (Also i didint have room for the bonus review but just know that its fun) 

Thanks Again,
Papa

Zombies is just about the only reason to purchase this game. 

It features some of the best maps in the franchise with Der Eisendrache, Zetsubou No Shima, and remade versions of prior zombies experiences.

The remakes are great (Although the Origin's remake is absurdly buggy, and generally lacks the polish of its original Black Ops 2 versions.) with the Black Ops 1 maps being stand out. 

Overall this is where zombies ended to me. Black Ops 4 was a total screw up with the amount of changes it made to previous tried and true systems and its zombie spawns and AI somehow being worse than this games.

But yeah Black Ops III is worth getting for zombies. MP is dead and who the hell plays these games campaigns anymore?

The game play was very good, but the campaign mode was fairly short and replayability is horrible. For most of the missions there are constant cut scenes. You can skip some of them, but not all of them and then there are large portions where you're just following around the NPC and you can't skip those parts. So you end up replaying a mission that takes 30-45 minutes but provides you with maybe 10 minutes of actual game play. I thought that it would be fun to try to get all of the various achievements, but got tired of waiting around doing nothing just to be able to try.

I bought the game long after its release, so there aren't any PvP servers with enough players to get regular games going.

For $15 I might have felt like I got my money's worth, but at $25 I feel like it could have been better spent on another first-person shooter.

Upsides: Casual friendly, eye candy design with minimal hit on performance, smooth mechanics, decent hit registration, variety of game types, rewarding multiplayer progression, fixed spawns.
Downsides: Poorly optimized for pc, unpopulated game modes, poor campaign, poorly marketed for pc, unbalanced weapons and teams, tunnel map design unfaborable by the fan base.
Best way to play: Specific weapons on specific maps, 2+ man squad, team deathmatch, special 2xp events.

Zombies in this game is 10/10, multiplayer is cool too. Easily one of the best Call of Duty games ever from a zombies perspective. While Zetsubou is a bit lackluster, every other zombies map in this game is a classic.  The addition of Zombies Chronicles took this game to a whole new level as well.  The multiplayer gets some hate for having so many good guns as well as still having futuristic movement, but honestly, it's still fun and doesn't contain cancerous campers *cough new Modern Warfare cough*.

As this game is kind of old now, the only thing to play in this game is custom zombies or even normal zombies.
The zombies experience in Black ops 3 is the best you can ever get in a call of duty game, as it has a very nice looking and full action first map with a very interesting story in Shadows of Evil. The bonus map the Giant or "Der Riese" Remastered is a very nice map for those who want to chill and kill zombies like the old days. The DLC season was very strong, as it has a lot of memorable maps like Der Eisendrache and Gorod Krovi. The last map "Revelations" is just pure nostalgia and Zetsubo no shima, although with it's flaws, still can be enjoyable. Last DLC pack is zombies chronicles which is a must buy, as it has the best maps of zombies like Kino der Toten and Origins and all of these old maps look very nice in the BO3 engine.
The gobblegum system exists, it is where you can make the game easier for you butyou can play without gobblegums. CALL OF DUTY 3 Zombies: is a very good game idea and plays very well but if it was not for the modes used on this game allowing you to survive an reach a win point by using money to escape the zombies thru a door called the buyable ending door.  If it was not for this then black ops zombies 3 would be like black ops One and Two both are done very poor because the game designers decided it would be a good idea or should i say a dumb idea that make no sense that the same zombie types get stronger and take 3 to 4 more bullets each level to be killed.  Adding more zombies was a great idea as you go but this bull shit of zombies of the same type getting stronger and stronger every level is such a poor idea. 

IT SUCKS WHEN PEOPLE/GAME DESIGNERS GET GOOD IDEAS BUT DON'T KNOW WHAT MAKES A GREAT GAME TO PLAY...
If you what to add a different type of zombie stronger one each level making it a little harder would of been cool but not this bad idea of same type. If you're buying this for zombies - which is the only reason you should be buying it - it boasts the best zombies mode I think there is to date. in terms of customization and map selection. However, for a very long time there has been persistent issues with crashes. I can't recommend buying this game in its current state because it simply won't run. The gameplay that's there is great, and I love the support for custom zombies maps, but I can barely play any zombies at all because every time I get into a match, solo or multiplayer, it crashes. Really frustrating when I put over an hour into a game and it just suddenly decides to crash. What a shame.

Update 2/2/20: Activision seems to have patched these issues. I have little to no issues with crashing at this point, and I've changed nothing in my build (but my PC case and some peripherals). Buy this game if you love zombies (probably not worth it at full price though)!

Hello, I made a review on this back at 2016, but that review wasn't even helpful so here is an updated version of the review.

I gotta say, Black Ops 3 is the goat of all Treyarch games. The gameplay mechanics are cool. But the stereotypical futuristic bull crap is there. But I don't give a hell about it. This is by far the best Black Ops game ever.

CAMPAIGN

The campaign storyline was the worst of the Black Ops storyline, but who cares?

MULTIPLAYER

The multiplayer mechanics are awesome with the double jumping, sliding and wall climbing, and the specialist abilities then makes the game completely overrun with spammers, great mechanics though, the weapons introduces us some new stankin' weapons. And even some throwbacks that we can recognize from older Call of Duty titles.

ZOMBIES

The most exiting part about this game is the zombie storyline. This storyline follows the Aether multiverse. In which Richtofen unleashes a "Great Evil" according to Takeo, then the multiverse is broken and they are up to restore it. But that should save it for Black Ops 4. It features some new maps, and remasters of our old and favorite maps from older titles, along with Steam Workshop support, this can support custom maps.

OVERALL

This game is a perfect Call of Duty title to pass the time, either finishing that horrid campaign, or playing with friends in Multiplayer Or Zombies.

SOFTWARE LICENSE AND SERVICE AGREEMENT

- I DISAGREE

Whereas this game's fanbase is a cancer, this is still an excellent ghame. Try not to listen to the people calling it overrated garbage. The small but vocal amount of people calling the the game overrated were told by others that it was the best game ever made, and when it did not meet those expectations, they justifiably thought it was overrated. This may be the best game ever to many, but not all. No matter what however, calling the game simply 'bad' instead of 'not perfect' or 'not my thing' would be an outright lie. Gameplay is tight and very creative, playing into the plot perfectly. I will not reveal any spoilers about this game since it is best to go in completely blind. If you are even somewhat interested in the genre or intrigued by the screenshots, buy this game. You will not regret it.

Pretty self explanatory game. If you're buying this game, chances are you've already played previous games in the franchise. Black Ops III has, in my opinion, the best zombies experience, just due to Zombies Chronicles alone. Brings mostly everything good from the previous zombies, as well as innovating things that were very welcomed to the community. Gobblegums make things easier-ish, but they increased the difficulty of the mode itself to balance it out. For me, zombies is an 10/10. Campaign is eh, didn't play it much anyways. 5/10. Multiplayer is exceptional, but due to exo jumping, it's not as good as it could be, but it makes sense considering it's futuristic. 8/10. Overall for BO3, I'd give it a solid 8.5/10.

Oh man, it's time for the best of the best when it comes to COD Zombies. I just want to start by saying Zombies Chronicles is a great DLC if you don't already own those maps but I will not be talking about this DLC in particular. Anyway lets talk Shadows of Evil. This map is pretty average when it comes to Bo3. the rituals can be annoying at times but overall that doesn't change the overall good vibe this map has, whether that be from the OP wonder weapon or the bomb easter egg. Next we have the Giant which is basically just Der Riese on the updated engine, really not much else to say. Next up is Der Eisendrache and oh my god I love this map. It's basically a love letter to Origins with a great easter egg and upgradeable bows. Next is Zetsubo No Shima and I can't say I really like this map. It takes way to long to setup and the atomsphere of a swampy jungle just doesn't work with me. Next is Gorod Krovi and this is another map that can be very hit or miss. If you love running around Soviet ruins then this map is for you but if you don't then there isn't much this map can offer you. Lastly is Revelations which is an overall good map but the easter egg was quite disappointing when the game came out but if you aren't doing the easter egg the map is quite a fun experience.
